Author: nuttycoin#5982
Content: how does KMD sync all of the txs going on in many side chains and form them into merkle roots? seems like there would be a bottleneck there no?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: notarisations

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its taking only the merkleroot of each block

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it doenst need all the txs

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: then it places the merkroots inside a tx on the otehr chain

Author: nuttycoin#5982
Content: what is "it" ?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the import logic

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it only needs a merkle root that validtes the transaction

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: sorry if i make no sense im really busy right now

Content: hm yea not sure if i understand it correctly, no worries though

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
@Steve Lee  @Mylo  
What is the status with AWS, I have found a use for the service in the short term. We can use an AWS end point, to do one of the steps for migrate transactions. Currently for testing all our test nodes require, the source chain, target chain and hte whole KMD chain synced. We can make the KMD part a centralised service, accessed via an AWS API... This will make it also much much easier for me to carry out a mass scale migrate test without requireing crazy crazy amounts of hardware and $$$.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: Noted @blackjok3r I‚Äôll watch #kmdlabs to get better understanding.  Mention me in there when possible

Content: `./komodo-cli sendtoaddress RXL3YXG2ceaB6C5hfJcN4fvmLH2C34knhA 100` change the address and amount

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: @blackjok3r  finally got a meeting yesterday with them. they've been quiet for the past few weeks due to the Reinvent conference where they launched QLDB and their managed service offerings.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: I'm setting up a meeting with their blockchain segment to discuss the joint testing and other GTM strategy

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: can we explore  if we can integrate AWS autoscaling with AC deployment?

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: so a solution where if TX hit a certain threshold an additional asset chain is deployed. James indicated this should be technically possible. would be something of interest to AWS, and the two people I spoke to about it were really interested in exploring that solution.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: tying it into the overall scaling solution test would also be a neat showcase if possible

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: That isn't technically impossible... A lot of the things we have been working on with #kmdlabs  will enable just this type of thing.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I can  say that once I have finished getting that launched and bug free we can make a PoC using AWS hosting.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Which should be a matter of weeks away. The full MoMoM tech was upstreamed to KMD yesterday, and while it will need to be tested there to make sure everythign required was merged up is right and all of it is there, seems like we can use AWS to both test this and an autoscaleing solution at once.

Content: The entire process is pretty safe and fine, butthe export tx is made incorrectly allowing you to import more coins than you burn. The coins are sent to the miner on the target chain.
